author: Michael Casagrande | mcasagrande@al.com
title: Bret Bielema: Incident 'blown out of catastrophic proportion,' Nick Saban says player took responsibility
text:
The on-going saga of Bret Bielema's involvement with a player scrum was addressed a few times on Wednesday's SEC coaches teleconference.
It began Sunday night when new video of Bielema entering a gathering a jawing Alabama and Arkansas players that ended with Tide lineman Cam Robinson's flag for unsportsmanlike conduct. Bielema appeared to fall backward right before the flag was thrown, leading to questions about the exact reason for the penalty.
The Arkansas coached called the whole controversy "got blown out of catastrophic proportion" and defended his decision to try and diffuse a situation.
Steve Shaw, the league's coordinator of officials said the play was officiated properly though he couldn't get into specifics. He said not to read much into the timing of the flag's appearance.
"Sometimes it can be an accumulation of activities on a play or series of plays when play gets chippy," Shaw said. "... For those type things, you have to look at the whole sequence and not just look at when the flag came out. I know people always say 'Wow, that was a late flag' as if a late flag is very, very bad. We want our guys to see it, know it and then throw it. So I'm not looking for fast flags. I'm looking for accurate flags."
Alabama coach Nick Saban said he still hasn't seen the new video of the incident but he did speak with Robinson about the play.
"His thoughts were, 'Hey, it's my responsibility. I got blocked. I got up and pushed a guy and whatever happened from then would have never happened if I had not been more emotional and had more personal discipline,'" Saban said. "I just talked to him about it. I asked him what he thought and he said he thought it was his responsibility, so I didn't even look at it."
The play in question followed an Alabama interception in front of the Arkansas bench. Bielema approached Robinson and an Arkansas players arguing after the whistle.
Bielema walked next to Robinson and appeared to fall backwards as if he were shoved by the Alabama left tackle. The linesman reached for his flag only after Bielema stumbled, though the video did not show any contact from Robinson. Bielema celebrated with a few fist pumps once he saw the flag tossed.
SEC commissioner Greg Sankey on Tuesday released a statement saying he'd spoken to Bielema about it and the flag was not a result of the coach's involvement in the scrum.
